page.title: 06The Liberation Stone
page.content: During the second world war, Jersey was occupied by German troops. The island was liberated on May 9th 1945. In 1985, forty years later, an inscribed granite stone was placed in a small raised garden at Trois Bois on the main road through the parish of St. Lawrence, at a site which was surrounded by German gun emplacements during the war. The stone with its inscription "to celebrate forty years of peace" was dedicated on May 9th 1985. On July 5th 1985 a copper urn was placed in a kist under the Liberation Stone, containing money, a news paper, list of names of all children in the two parish schools, St. Lawrence and Bel Royal, and other items of local interest. Instructions have been left for the urn to be opened in the year 2045.
